fr.zcraft.quartzlib.tools.items

Class TextualBanners

  • java.lang.Object
    • fr.zcraft.quartzlib.tools.items.TextualBanners

  • public final class TextualBanners
extends Object
    Utility class to manipulate banners.

    Original repository : https://github.com/FlorianCassayre/BannersUtils

    Author:
    Florian Cassayre

      • getPatterns

        public static List<org.bukkit.block.banner.Pattern> getPatterns(org.bukkit.DyeColor color,
                                                                org.bukkit.block.banner.PatternType... types)
        Return a list of patterns with the same color.
        Parameters:
        color - The generic color that will be used
        types - The layers to be printed on the banner using the chosen color
        Returns:
        A copy of this banner

                                                       List<org.bukkit.block.banner.Pattern> patterns)
        Returns a banner containing the patterns with the background color.
        Parameters:
        color - The background color
        patterns - The layers to be printed on the banner
        Returns:
        An ItemStack containing these parameters

      • getCharBanner

        public static org.bukkit.inventory.ItemStack getCharBanner(char c,
                                                           org.bukkit.DyeColor color)
        Returns a banner item stack which represents the following character, with a specified background and the specified color.
        Parameters:
        c - The character to be printed
        color - The font color
        Returns:
        A banner ItemStack with the corresponding character using a basic font system
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the character isn't registered.

      • getCharBanner

        public static org.bukkit.inventory.ItemStack getCharBanner(char c,
                                                           org.bukkit.DyeColor color,
                                                           boolean border)
        Returns a banner item stack which represents the following character, with the specified color, and possibly a border.
        Parameters:
        c - The character to be printed
        color - The font color
        border - If set to true, then a border will be applied to the banner
        Returns:
        A banner ItemStack with the corresponding character using a basic font system
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the character isn't registered.

                                                                    org.bukkit.DyeColor background,
